comments:
I am using Eclipse 2.0 as IDE for my weblogic application. 
The application was in 6.0 then debugging through Eclipse was fine. 
But now when we have moved to weblogic 6.1, my debugging through eclipse does 
not work.
I am getting following error (The class mentioned in exception is there in 
classpath tho' RT.jar still I am getting ClassNotFound errro):
**********************************
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance
(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance
(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:27)
	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:274)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:296)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:249)
	at javax.rmi.CORBA.Util.createDelegateIfSpecified(Util.java:339)
	at javax.rmi.CORBA.Util.<clinit>(Util.java:51)
	at javax.rmi.PortableRemoteObject.createDelegateIfSpecified
(PortableRemoteObject.java:179)
	at javax.rmi.PortableRemoteObject.<clinit>(PortableRemoteObject.java:58)
	at 
com.marsh.common.service.security.cansys.model.AuthorizationServiceProxy.lookuph
ome(AuthorizationServiceProxy.java:250)
	at 
com.marsh.common.service.security.cansys.model.AuthorizationServiceProxy.getServ
ice(AuthorizationServiceProxy.java:197)
	at 
com.marsh.common.service.security.cansys.model.AuthorizationServiceProxy.authent
icateToken(AuthorizationServiceProxy.java:147)
	at marsh.cansys.common.InitialActionCanCR.perform
(InitialActionCanCR.java:128)
	at org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet.processActionPerform
(ActionServlet.java:1775)
	at org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet.process
(ActionServlet.java:1574)
	at org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet.doPost(ActionServlet.java:508)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:760)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet
(ServletStubImpl.java:265)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet
(ServletStubImpl.java:200)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.invokeServlet
(WebAppServletContext.java:2546)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletRequestImpl.execute
(ServletRequestImpl.java:2260)
	at weblogic.kernel.ExecuteThread.execute(ExecuteThread.java:139)
	at weblogic.kernel.ExecuteThread.run(ExecuteThread.java:120)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: could not find or instantiate any 
UtilDelegate class
	at weblogic.iiop.UtilDelegateImpl.<clinit>(UtilDelegateImpl.java:74)
	... 25 more
>
**************************************

This does not look like a debugger problem - rather a runtime problem with 
application code. Does the code run (i.e. as oppossed to debug) properly? Does 
it run from the command line properly. The exception indicates: "Signals that 
an unexpected exception has occurred in a static initializer. An 
ExceptionInInitializerError is thrown to indicate that an exception occurred 
during evaluation of a static initializer or the initializer for a static 
variable."
I suggest catching the exception to see what is going on.

Hi Darin,
Thanks for the response. I did not write other details, which are as follows:
My application works fine, when I am doing remote debugging using eclipse. In 
that case, I run weblogic server from command prompt(on Win2000 server) and 
listen at some port. Then I debug it through eclipse, by using remote debug 
option. 
The above mentioned problem occurs, when I am trying to run weblogic itself 
through eclipse and do the debugging.
My classpath in later case has all the jars, that I have used for remote 
debugging. So I am not able to figure out the cause of the problem.

When you launch the process from Eclipse, the debug view will contain the 
launch, along with the "debug target", and Java VM process. Could you look at 
the properties of the Java VM process (pop-up menu in the debug view). This 
will display the actual command line used to launch the process. If you could 
paste the result into this bug report, along with the command line you use to 
launch weblogic manually, it might give some insight.
marking as works for me - unless there are more details that can be provided.

causedBy.message: could not find or instantiate any  UtilDelegate class
